title: Enable Portfolio Margin - EN
text:
To Enable **Portfolio Margin** please follow the steps in the screenshots above:

**1 -)** Click on **Futures**.

**2 -)** Click on the **"..."** Icon on the top right corner.

**3 -)** Click on the **"Portfolio Margin"** button on the pop-up menu.

**4 -)** Select **"Portfolio Margin"**.

**5 -)** Click on **"Switch"** and confirm.

---

To Learn more about Portfolio Margin, here are some detailed guides:

* [Introduction to Binance Portfolio Margin Mode](https://www.binance.com/support/faq/detail/bddd924496d74ecd8820a6d95585ccee)
* [How to View Portfolio Margin Information from Your Binance Account and Trading Interface?](https://www.binance.com/support/faq/detail/07bd62ee3fe24461a623da54fa0f2865)

If you have any additional questions, please don't hesitate to share them with me.

title: Futures Notification for TP/SL/Funding 合约通知设置（止盈/止损/资金费率）- CN
text:

2）在弹出菜单中点击【偏好设置】

4）在此页面中，您可以启用或关闭以下通知：

止盈 / 止损触发：
当任意止盈或止损被触发时接收通知。每日最多 25 条 通知。

资金费率触发：
设置资金费率阈值；当任一持仓的预计资金费率超过该比例时，您将收到提醒。

合约交易：
当合约订单成交时接收通知。

追加保证金提醒：
默认阈值为 80%。点击【编辑】可设置不同的保证金率；当您的仓位达到该比例时，您将收到通知。

title: Futures Swap Button (BNFCR) - EN
text:
You **can't directly transfer** BNFCR back to spot wallet, so you need to **swap it to BNB, BTC, or ETH** first to transfer it back to spot wallet.

### **Step-by-Step Process:**

1 -) **Click on** `Assets`
2 -) **Click on** `Futures`
3 -) **Click on** `USDsM Futures`
4 -) **Click on** `SWAP`

---

### **In the SWAP Page:**

- **Select** BNFCR 
- **Swap it** to one of the supported coins *(ETH, BNB, or BTC)*

---

> **Please make sure to select** `USDsM Futures` **from both options**

- ✅ **Choose the** *second sub-category option* **for your selected coin** (BNB, ETH, or BTC)
- ✅ **Select the** *first sub-category option* **for BNFCR**

---

Once you have these supported assets, you **can transfer them back to spot wallet** ✅

title: What Is Funding Rate? - EN
text:
The Funding Rate determines which traders pay or receive Funding Fees and what percentage of their positions is involved.

On Binance Futures, Funding Fees are exchanged regularly to keep the perpetual futures prices aligned with the spot price. Typically, funding occurs every 8 hours, precisely at 00:00 UTC, 08:00 UTC, and 16:00 UTC. However, during periods of significant price divergence between the spot market and the perpetual futures contract, Binance may adjust funding intervals to shorter periods, such as every 4 hours, 2 hours, or even 1 hour, to better manage market stability.

When the market is in a state of contango, meaning that the futures prices are higher than the spot price, the Funding Rate will be positive. In this scenario, traders holding long positions in perpetual futures contracts will pay Funding Fees to traders holding short positions.

On the other hand, when the market is in a state of backwardation, meaning that the futures prices are lower than the spot price, the Funding Rate will be negative. In this scenario, traders holding short positions in perpetual futures contracts will pay Funding Fees to traders holding long positions.

title: ADL Indicator/Explanation - EN
text:
The red/green exclamation(s) you may have seen after the leverage of your position is relevant to the Auto-Deleveraging (ADL) on Binance. Four red exclamations indicate that you are at the top of the queue but even when all are illuminated, ADL happens extremely rarely. As you may know, when the profit-loss difference between long positions and short positions cannot be covered by the Insurance fund, the positions with the highest profit will be closed automatically. This process is called Auto Deleverage or Counterparty Liquidation. ADL is a different transaction from a normal liquidation, in case of ADL you take the current profit on your position and you have the chance to take the position again. You can liken this process to closing your position in profit.

In the simplified way, you can imagine that there is 1100 USDT to profit but only 1000 USDT in total loss due to the trader’s bankruptcy and of course, normally, Insurance funds will cover this difference. However, when this difference becomes too huge to be handled by Insurance Funds, the users with the most percentage of winnings start to get positions closed by ADL, they of course won’t lose anything and profit completely. The only thing is their positions have to be forcibly closed but they can continuously participate in market anytime after this procedure.

title: Stop-Market & Stop-Limit Differences - EN
text:
The difference between Stop-Market and Stop-Limit orders, based on the pros and cons of market and limit orders:

**Stop-Market Order:**

It triggers a market order when the stop price is reached.
Your order will execute immediately at the best available price.
You are guaranteed your order will be filled, but the exact price may be different from your stop price, especially in fast-moving markets.
This helps protect you from big losses by closing the position quickly but might cause some slippage (difference between expected and actual price).

**Stop-Limit Order:**

It triggers a limit order when the stop price is reached.
Your order will only execute at the limit price you set or better, so you control the execution price.
However, your order might not get filled if the market price moves away from your limit price.
This gives you price certainty but no guarantee your order will be executed, which can be risky in volatile markets.

In short:

**Stop-Market =** guaranteed execution, no price guarantee (better for quick exit).

**Stop-Limit =** price guaranteed, no execution guarantee (better when you want to control trade price).

Types of Order on Binance Futures

Choose the type that matches your trading goal and risk management best!

title: How to REPAY ALL on Cross Margin - EN
text:
Here is the step-by-step pathway to access the "Repay All" function and a clear summary of what happens when you use it.

Follow these steps to navigate to the Repay All function:

1.  Click **[Trade]**

2.  Click **[Margin]**

3.  Click **[Cross]**

4.  Click **[Repay All]**

5.  Click **[Confirm]**

---

**What does 'Repay All' do?**

In summary, **Repay All** is a "De-Risking" button. It is designed to stop you from paying interest on loans without forcing you to sell your crypto assets.

When you click **[Confirm]**, the system performs three immediate actions:

* 🛑 **Stops Activity:** It cancels all your pending open orders so the math doesn't change while it's working.
* 🧮 **Calculates Debt:** It adds up every dollar you owe across all your different coins.
* 💸 **Pays the Bill:** It uses your available free balance (or sells just enough of your assets if necessary) to pay off that debt to zero.

**The Result:** You walk away with **Zero Debt** (so you stop paying interest), but you **keep your positions** (you still hold your Bitcoin, Ethereum, etc.).

> **Note:** This only works if your total debt is under **150,000 USDT**. If you owe more, you must repay some manually first.

To Learn more about the details, I suggest you to check the official guide:

[How to Use the Close Position and Repay Functions on Binance Margin?](https://www.binance.com/support/faq/detail/0ec778021b7a4f14b1b334f74b764b77)

**What does 'Repay All Symbols Debt' do?**

In summary, **Repay All Symbols Debt** is a comprehensive "Clean Slate" button for your **Isolated Margin** account. It is designed to clear all debts across all your different Isolated pairs at once using your available assets.

When you click **[Confirm]**, the system performs the following actions:

* 💸 **Uses Available Funds:** It first uses any available assets you hold to repay your liabilities directly.
* ⚖️ **Closes Remaining Debt:** If your available funds aren't enough, it places market orders to sell assets and cover the remaining debt.
* 🛡️ **Buffer Added:** The system might place an order slightly higher (approx. +1%) than the exact debt amount to ensure there are enough funds to fully clear the balance.

**The Result:** You aim to walk away with **Zero Debt** across all your Isolated Margin trading pairs.

To Learn more about the details, I suggest you to check the official guide:

[How to Use the Close Position and Repay Functions on Binance Margin?](https://www.binance.com/support/faq/detail/0ec778021b7a4f14b1b334f74b764b77)

title: How to CLOSE POSITION on Isolated Margin - EN
text:
Here is the step-by-step pathway to access the "Close Position" menu on Isolated Margin and a clear summary of the two options available inside.

Follow these steps to navigate to the function:

1.  Click **[Trade]**.
2.  Click **[Margin]**.
3.  Click **[Isolated]**.
4.  Click **[Positions]**.
5.  Click **[Close Position]** next to the specific pair.

**Now, choose your desired action from the tabs:**

* **Option A (Full Exit):** Select the **[Close Position]** tab, choose which token to **[Settle in]**, and click **[Confirm]**.

* **Option B (Clear Debt Only):** Select the **[Repay Debt]** tab and click **[Confirm]**.

---

**A. What does 'Close Position' (Tab 1) do?**

In summary, the **Close Position** tab is your "Exit Strategy." It fully exits the Isolated Margin position for that specific pair.

* 🛑 **Settle & Convert:** You choose which cryptocurrency to settle in (e.g., USDC or DOGE). The system repays outstanding debt and converts the remaining assets into that chosen cryptocurrency.
* 📦 **Transfer to Spot:** Once completed, any remaining assets are automatically transferred to your Spot account.
* ⚖️ **Limit:** The position must be worth more than 0.01 USDT to use this function.

**B. What does 'Repay Debt' (Tab 2) do?**

In summary, the **Repay Debt** tab is a "Liability Clearer." It focuses only on paying back what you owe without necessarily closing your entire trade.

* 💸 **Uses Available Assets:** It uses your available assets to repay liabilities first.
* 📉 **Sells if Needed:** If you don't have enough cash, it places market orders to sell just enough of your position to cover the debt.
* 🛡️ **Buffer:** The system adds an approximate **1% buffer** to the order amount to ensure there are sufficient funds to fully repay the debt.

To Learn more about the details, I suggest you to check the official guide:

[How to Use the Close Position and Repay Functions on Binance Margin?](https://www.binance.com/support/faq/detail/0ec778021b7a4f14b1b334f74b764b77)

**Şimdi, sekmelerden yapmak istediğiniz işlemi seçin:**

* **Seçenek A (Tam Çıkış):** **[Pozisyonu Kapat]** (Close Position) sekmesini seçin, hangi varlık ile **[Uzlaşmak]** (Settle in) istediğinizi seçin ve **[Onayla]** (Confirm) butonuna tıklayın.

* **Seçenek B (Sadece Borç Öde):** **[Borcu Öde]** (Repay Debt) sekmesini seçin ve **[Onayla]** (Confirm) butonuna tıklayın.

---

**A. 'Pozisyonu Kapat' (Close Position - 1. Sekme) ne işe yarar?**

Özetle, **Pozisyonu Kapat** sekmesi sizin "Çıkış Stratejinizdir." O pariteye ait İzole Marjin pozisyonundan tamamen çıkmanızı sağlar.

* 🛑 **Uzlaş ve Dönüştür:** Hangi kripto para birimi ile uzlaşacağınızı seçersiniz (örn. USDC veya DOGE). Sistem mevcut borcu öder ve kalan varlıkları seçilen kripto para birimine dönüştürür.
* 📦 **Spot'a Transfer:** İşlem tamamlandığında, kalan varlıklar otomatik olarak Spot hesabınıza transfer edilir.
* ⚖️ **Limit:** Bu işlevi kullanabilmek için pozisyon değerinin 0.01 USDT'den yüksek olması gerekir.

**B. 'Borcu Öde' (Repay Debt - 2. Sekme) ne işe yarar?**

Özetle, **Borcu Öde** sekmesi bir "Borç Temizleyici"dir. Varlıkların hepsini dönüştürmeden, sadece borçlandığınız miktarı geri ödemeye odaklanır.

* 💸 **Mevcut Varlıkları Kullanır:** Yükümlülükleri ödemek için önce elinizdeki kullanılabilir varlıkları kullanır.
* 📉 **Gerekirse Satar:** Eğer yeterli nakdiniz yoksa, sadece borcu karşılayacak kadar varlık satmak için piyasa emirleri oluşturur.
* 🛡️ **Tampon:** Sistem, borcun tamamının ödenmesini garanti altına almak için emir tutarına yaklaşık **%1'lik bir tampon** ekler.
